title: Roxy Fonts : a brand new foundry from Mexico
content:
After almost one year in the making, Roxy Fonts, the first mexican digital type foundry is here with a monthly offering of six new fonts designed in and with love by Victor Yb Delgado.   
   
For our inaugural issue of March 2002 we have selected some of our most original work : the elongated but strange elegance of [Moneyca Boulevard](http://web.archive.org/web/20140712145623/http:/www.roxyfonts.com/fontshop/moneyk/mny.htm), a huggy bear feeling with [Polara](http://web.archive.org/web/20140712145623/http:/www.roxyfonts.com/fontshop/polara/pol.htm), the fun and rhythm of [Kofika](http://web.archive.org/web/20140712145623/http:/www.roxyfonts.com/fontshop/kofika/kfk.htm), plus the sheer novelty of [Zarza](http://web.archive.org/web/20140712145623/http:/www.roxyfonts.com/fontshop/zarza/zrz.htm) and [Exboy](http://web.archive.org/web/20140712145623/http:/www.roxyfonts.com/fontshop/exboy/exb.htm) families.   
   
And don't miss our free download of the month, [Weirdiac](http://web.archive.org/web/20140712145623/http:/www.roxyfonts.com/fontshop/weirdiac/wei.htm), a manic drugressive dingbat font!   
   
Roxy Fonts is an indie space where words like repetitive, derivative and, most of all, expensive are never spoken.   
   
...a little type corner you will definitely want to bookmark.   
   
Roxy Fonts, for the love of type   
 [www.roxyfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20140712145623/http:/www.roxyfonts.com/)
author: victoryb

hhp

I am very sorry to announce that Roxy Fonts will have to change it's name. The six fonts scheduled for a march release (Kofika, Zarza, Polara, Exboy, Weirdiac and Moneyca Boulevard) will find a new home in a few days. For now, I'm doing my best to find not a font, but a COMPANY name that's not taken and that's at least a bit catchy... plus a new domain name.   
Names, names, names...   
watch this space or look up soon at MyFonts.com
